intro: Caloscilla subalbida, commonly known as the white-flowered caloscilla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Caloscilla subalbida is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky outcrops.
